data: The Card component offers a flexible and customizable way to display content. Below are the details of the properties and usage examples.
data.basic-card#Basic Card:
Go Somewhere
<Card
  title="Card title"
  text="Some quick example text to build on the card title and make up the bulk of the card's content."
>
  <Button variant="primary" size="medium" className="mt-4">
    Go Somewhere
  </Button>
</Card>

data.installation#Installation:
Start by installing react-select:
yarn add react-select
or
npm i --save react-select
The Select component is a customizable select input built on top of the react-select library. It provides various features such as multi-select, search functionality, clearable options, and more.
data.props#Props: Prop	Type	Default	Description	options	array	-	An array of options to display in the select menu. Each option is an object with value and label keys.	defaultValue	object	-	The default selected option.	isDisabled	bool	false	Whether the select input is disabled.	isLoading	bool	false	Whether the select input is loading.	isClearable	bool	true	Whether the selected option can be cleared.	isRtl	bool	false	Whether to display the select input in right-to-left mode.	isSearchable	bool	false	Whether the select input is searchable.	isMulti	bool	false	Whether to enable multi-select functionality.	className	string	'basic-single'	Additional CSS classes to apply to the select input.	classNamePrefix	string	'select'	Prefix for the CSS class names.	name	string	'select'	The name attribute of the select input.	placeholder	string	'Select...'	Placeholder text for the select input.	props	object	-	Additional props passed to the react-select component.
